ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My childs chronotype

ElementDescription: I need 8 hours of sleep to feel refreshed and function well during the day
When I don't get proper amount of sleep on a given night, I need to catch up on the next day by napping or on the next night by sleeping longer
I am concerned that chronic insomnia may have serious consequences on my physical health
I am worried that I may lose control over my abilities to sleep
After a poor nights sleep, I know that it will interfere with my daily activities on the next day
In order to be alert and function well during the day, I believe I would be better off taking a sleeping pill rather than having a poor nights sleep
When I feel irritable, depressed, or anxious during the day, it is mostly because I did not sleep well the night before
When I sleep poorly on one night, I know it will disturb my sleep schedule for the whole week
Without an adequate nights sleep, I can hardly function the next day
I cant ever predict whether Ill have a good or poor nights sleep
I have little ability to manage the negative consequences of disturbed sleep
When I feel tired, have no energy, or just seem not to function well during the day, it is generally because I did not sleep well the night before
I believe insomnia is essentially the result of a chemical imbalance
I feel insomnia is ruining my ability to enjoy life and prevents me from doing what I want
Medication is probably the only solution to sleeplessness
I avoid or cancel obligations (social, family) after a poor nights sleep

Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
During the past 2 weeks, how much sleep would you say you got most nights?
Notes: 0=I got as much sleep as I needed; 1=I sometimes wish I could get more sleep; 2=I often felt I needed a lot more sleep; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: During the past 2 weeks, how long did it usually take you to fall asleep at night after turning off the lights?
Notes: 0=Less than 20-30 minutes; 1=Between 30 minutes and 1 hour; 2=More than 1 hour; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: During the past 2 weeks, how many times did it take you more than about 20-30 minutes for you to fall asleep?
Notes: 0=0 times; 1=1-3 times; 2=More than 3 times; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: During the past 2 weeks, how many times did you wake up in the middle of the night after falling fully asleep?
Notes: 0=0 times; 1=1-3 times; 2=More than 3 times; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: During the past 2 weeks, if you woke up in the middle of the night at all, how long did it usually take for you to fall back asleep?
Notes: 0=I didn''t wake up in the middle of the night; 1=Less than 30 minutes on most nights I woke up; 2=More than 30 minutes on most nights I woke up; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: During the past 2 weeks, how many time did you wake up earlier than your normal time to wake, just because you couldn''t stay asleep?
Notes: 0=I woke up at my normal time, or only when my alarm or someone woke me up; 1=I woke up too early 1-3 times; 2=I woke up too early more than 3 times; 77=Don''t know; 88=Refused; 99=Missing data

ElementDescription: Rate how much the Recording System disturbed your sleep: Garmin Rating
Notes: 1= Extremely disturbed compared to my usual sleep; 2= Moderately disturbed compared to my usual sleep; 3= Mildly disturbed compared to my usual sleep; 4= Minimally disturbed compared to my usual sleep; 5= My sleep was typical of my usual sleep (no interference)

ElementDescription: How did the Garmin smartwatch disturb your sleep?
Notes: 1= I had more difficulty falling asleep than usual; 2= I woke up more frequently during the night than is typical; 3= I woke up earlier than usual and could not go back to sleep; 4= The quality of my sleep was poorer than usual (i.e.= non-restorative sleep); 5= Other

ElementDescription: Please specify how the Garmin smartwatch disturbed your sleep
